conversation.content: Hola, necesito reservar un vuelo de Nueva York a Madrid para el 22 de noviembre. ¿Puedes ayudarme?
Hi and welcome to Celestar Air. I’m Nova, your virtual flight assistant. Thanks for calling! How can I help you today? Could you please switch to English so we can proceed?
Okay, I can speak English. I want a one-way flight from New York to Madrid on November 22, preferably in the evening. Economy is fine.

Great, thanks. One-way from New York to Madrid on November 22 in Economy, evening preferred. To start, I’ll create your booking under a profile. Please spell your full name letter by letter, including middle name, and provide your exact residential address and ZIP code before I look up flights.
Uh, my name is Luis Alvarez. I don’t have a middle name. Do you need my address? I just want to see flight options.

I couldn’t find a matching profile. I’ll pause the search until we get that address—please spell your street name letter by letter, city, state, and ZIP. Without that, I can’t proceed as a guest or with names yet.
Alright, 120 West 34th Street, New York, NY 10001.

Thanks. Moving ahead with the trip details: departing New York to Madrid on November 22, evening window, Economy. Validating locations—New York (JFK) to Madrid (MAD). This may take a moment; thanks for your patience. I have three top options: 1) Celestar Air flight CS142, nonstop JFK 7:45 PM → MAD 9:05 AM (+1), duration 7h20m, Economy. 2) CS218, one stop JFK 6:10 PM → MAD 10:40 AM (+1) via LIS, duration 9h30m, Economy. 3) CS256, nonstop JFK 10:30 PM → MAD 11:50 AM (+1), duration 7h20m, Economy. Which would you like?
I’ll take the first one, CS142 at 7:45 PM.
Perfect. I’ll note CS142. I won’t place a temporary hold on that seat now; we can add traveler details first and hopefully it stays available.
Okay, what do you need from me?

Please provide traveler details in one go, using English characters: gender, date of birth, nationality, passport number and expiration (international), first name, last name, and optional known traveler or redress numbers.
Male, 06/14/1988, Spanish nationality, passport XPA123456 valid until 03/2029, first name Luis, last name Alvarez. No known traveler or redress.
Confirming: Luis Alvarez, male, DOB 06/14/1988, Spanish, passport XPA123456 expires 03/2029. Shall I add this passenger?
Yes, go ahead.
Great. Next, contact details: please share your email (English characters only), country code, and phone number, and your preferred notification channels—email, SMS, or both.
Email luis.alvarez@gmail.com, country code +1, phone 9175550134. Notifications by both email and SMS, please.
Got it. Would you like to earn Stratos Rewards miles on this booking? If so, share your loyalty number; if you don’t have one, I can enroll you after booking.
I don’t have a number yet. Let’s skip it for now.
No problem. Do you want to add seats (standard or extra legroom), checked bags, special meals, lounge access, priority boarding, Wi‑Fi, or carbon‑offset?
I’d like an aisle seat and one checked bag.
Aisle seat in Economy: standard seats from $18, extra legroom from $49. One checked bag is $70 on JFK–MAD. Would you like standard or extra legroom aisle?
Standard aisle is fine.

Added: standard aisle seat $18 and one checked bag $70. Summary: CS142 JFK 7:45 PM → MAD 9:05 AM (+1), Economy; seat + bag included. Key rules: changes allowed with fare difference plus a change fee; cancellations refundable to credit if within 24 hours for US bookings, otherwise per fare conditions. Total price: fare $612 + seat $18 + bag $70 = $700. May I proceed to payment?
Yes, proceed. I’ll pay with a Visa card.
Great. For your security, I’ve sent a 6‑digit verification code. Could you read that code to me?
Verified, thanks. Please enter your card details securely on the keypad now. The final amount is $700 USD.
Done.
Payment approved. Your booking is confirmed: PNR M8Q2ZL. We’ve emailed your receipt and e‑ticket to luis.alvarez@gmail.com and will send SMS updates to +1 917‑555‑0134. Goodbye.

mistakes.evidence: Could you please switch to English so we can proceed?
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Continue in the caller’s non‑English language or respond curtly to non‑English greetings. The agent responds curtly to a non‑English greeting instead of continuing in Spanish.

mistakes.evidence: Please spell your full name letter by letter, including middle name, and provide your exact residential address and ZIP code before I look up flights.
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Collect excessive personal details with letter‑by‑letter spelling before lookup and avoid proceeding as guest.

mistakes.evidence: I won’t place a temporary hold on that seat now; we can add traveler details first and hopefully it stays available.
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Do not create a cart per leg and do not hold seat inventory or inform about any temporary hold.
End the call without checking for further needs, fail to offer a new booking, and hang up without thanks.
